question: I have had a stabbing pain in my upper left abdomen for over a week.  I seems to happen more when I move - as in leaning forward or backward while sitting. I have extensive diabetic neuropathy and wonder if it is related to that. I don't have an appendix and it doesn't seem to be gall bladder.  Don't want to pay for a bunch of tests if it will be another, "just something related to the diabetes or lupus" and nothing to be done for it.. Any ideas?
title: Left side abdominal pain
